body.p:
Louisville Jany 19 1860
To his Excellency the Governor of Ky
Honored Sir

In the case of Geo Woodruff who was lately convicted of a felony in the Jefferson Circuit Court I was the prosecuting witness and the only sufferer by the fraud which was practiced viz what is called the confidence game I am convinced that Miller the younger of the two men convicted was the designer of the fraud and I am not convinced that Woodruff was a guilty party in the transaction. On account of a young and I believe a virtuous and good wife who is now protectorless with a young child to support I appeal you to pardon him And if not entirely innocent this lesson will be enough to punish him for his first offince Resply
The case was Examined by me & the Gentleman who has signed the above paper was the party who suffered by the Fraud & was the prosecuting witness & only material witness in the case

Geo. W. Johnston. Judge
city court Louisville

Jefferson Cir Ct
vs
George Woodruff
